keyResults.title: By fixing 9 Reps Portal bugs I have a good understanding of the Reps Portal code
Council is accountable and knows what to expect and therefore has a better foundation
Everybody can make better decisions based on Mentors Overview directory on the Reps Portal
By fixing 4 Firefox bugs I have a general understanding of modern Firefox source code
By organizing an informal Mozilla Bern meetup I initiate knowledge transfer
By helping Martin organize a ZH meetup I continue the knowledge transfer
I tell the world how I came to Mozilla with a 10 years Mozilla blogpost
Reading Design Pattern / Full Stack React / Django book / Learning Python allows me to get a broader view
By reading Tao of Coaching I fresh up on coaching tactics
Better goal achievement by creating a new OKR tool
By joining 2 non-Mozilla meetup I learned something I haven't known before
By understanding basic grammar and 150 words in Greek I can have a small conversation
I show strategic thinking capabilities by giving feedback on Mission Driven Mozillians Project (Project Owner Rating)
I bring Accountability and Context to Council through Peers (Council Rating)
Reps Portal without major functionality missing or bugs allows Reps to be efficient (Council Rating)
By migrating self hosted Reps Tools I assure functionality (Mentors)
By fixing 20 bugs in Firefox I am confident with the modern Firefox source code
By organizing at least 6 meetups I have impact on the local community
By running at least 2 small experiments I learn how to do useful experiments
By learning Python/Django I can fully support OI Products&Engineering (Team Rating)
By reading the JS spec I can answer more low-level questions about JavaScript
My skillset is more diverse by using React / Vue for at least 2 projects
Reading 10 IT related books broadens my horizon on IT topics
Reading 4 Strategic Thinking / Coaching / PM books broadens my horizon on career relevant topics
By joining 12 non-Mozilla meetups I acquire new capabilities and socialize with new people
Contributing to at least 2 other Open Source Projects than Mozilla helps me put Mozilla in context
Learning Greek allows me to have a good, not too simple conversation
